verses.text: Why, seeing times are not hidden from the Almighty , do they that know him not see his days ?
\add Some\add* remove the landmarks ; they violently take away flocks , and feed \add thereof\add*.\f + \fr 24.2 \ft feed…: or, feed them\f*
They drive away the ass of the fatherless , they take the widow’s ox for a pledge.
They turn the needy out of the way : the poor of the earth hide themselves together.
Behold, \add as\add* wild asses in the desert , go they forth to their work ; rising betimes for a prey : the wilderness \add yieldeth\add* food for them \add and\add* for \add their\add* children.

They reap \add every one\add* his corn in the field : and they gather the vintage of the wicked.\f + \fr 24.6 \ft corn: Heb. mingled corn, or, dredge\f*\f + \fr 24.6 \ft they gather…: Heb. the wicked gather the vintage\f*
They cause the naked to lodge without clothing , that \add they have\add* no covering in the cold.
They are wet with the showers of the mountains , and embrace the rock for want of a shelter.
They pluck the fatherless from the breast , and take a pledge of the poor.
They cause \add him\add* to go naked without clothing , and they take away the sheaf \add from\add* the hungry ;
\add Which\add* make oil within their walls , \add and\add* tread \add their\add* winepresses , and suffer thirst.
Men groan from out of the city , and the soul of the wounded crieth out : yet God layeth not folly \add to them\add*. \p
They are of those that rebel against the light ; they know not the ways thereof, nor abide in the paths thereof.
The murderer rising with the light killeth the poor and needy , and in the night is as a thief.
The eye also of the adulterer waiteth for the twilight , saying , No eye shall see me: and disguiseth \add his\add* face.\f + \fr 24.15 \ft disguiseth…: Heb. setteth his face in secret\f*
In the dark they dig through houses , \add which\add* they had marked for themselves in the daytime : they know not the light.
For the morning \add is\add* to them even as the shadow of death : if \add one\add* know \add them, they are in\add* the terrors of the shadow of death. \p
He \add is\add* swift as the waters ; their portion is cursed in the earth : he beholdeth not the way of the vineyards.
Drought and heat consume the snow waters : \add so doth\add* the grave \add those which\add* have sinned.\f + \fr 24.19 \ft consume: Heb. violently take\f*
The womb shall forget him; the worm shall feed sweetly on him; he shall be no more remembered ; and wickedness shall be broken as a tree.
He evil entreateth the barren \add that\add* beareth not: and doeth not good to the widow.
He draweth also the mighty with his power : he riseth up , and no \add man\add* is sure of life.\f + \fr 24.22 \ft no…: or, he trusteth not his own life\f*
\add Though\add* it be given him \add to be\add* in safety , whereon he resteth ; yet his eyes \add are\add* upon their ways.

They are exalted for a little while , but are gone and brought low ; they are taken out of the way as all \add other\add*, and cut off as the tops of the ears of corn.\f + \fr 24.24 \ft are gone: Heb. are not\f*\f + \fr 24.24 \ft taken…: Heb. closed up\f*
And if \add it be\add* not \add so\add* now , who will make me a liar , and make my speech nothing worth ?
